item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Plaxico Burress, former New York Giants receiver, indicted on weapons charge but Antonio Pierce not indicted
item.description: Former New York Giants star Plaxico Burress was indicted by a grand jury on weapons charges for shooting himself in the thigh at a Manhattan nightclub and faces a minimum prison sentence of 3.5 years if convicted.

item.dc:creator: Chris Low
item.title: Florida Gators make Urban Meyer highest paid in SEC with 6-year, $24 million deal
item.description: Urban Meyer, who has taken the Florida Gators to rarified heights with two national championships in four seasons, will see his salary climb to equally exclusive company.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Emotional Denny Hamlin breaks skid with Pocono Raceway win
item.description: Denny Hamlin has ended a 50-race winless skid by holding off Juan Pablo Montoya over the final thrilling laps to win at Pocono Raceway.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Report: Philadelphia Eagles middle linebacker Stewart Bradley likely to miss season with torn ACL
item.description: Eagles middle linebacker Stewart Bradley will likely miss the season with a torn ACL, a source told ESPN 950 in Philadelphia.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Appeal for Buffalo Bills' Marshawn Lynch denied, out three games
item.description: The league announced that Marshawn Lynch's three-game suspension will stand.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Edinson Volquez, Cincinnati Reds pitcher, has Tommy John surgery
item.description: Reds right-hander Edinson Volquez is expected to miss the rest of this season and the first half of next year, too.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: WAC reprimands Hawaii coach Greg McMackin for using gay slur
item.description: The Western Athletic Conference is reprimanding Hawaii coach Greg McMackin for his derogatory comment while describing Notre Dame's chant before last year's Hawaii Bowl.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Reports: Roger Mayweather charged in incident
item.description: Roger Mayweather, the uncle and trainer of Floyd Mayweather Jr., was arrested and charged in Las Vegas this weekend.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Carolina Panthers' Maake Kemoeatu suffers torn Achilles tendon
item.description: Panthers defensive tackle Maake Kemoeatu has a torn Achilles tendon and could miss the season.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Reports: Arena Football League will fold soon, declare bankruptcy
item.description: Multiple media outlets are reporting that the Arena Football League will fold.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Houston Astros' Roy Oswalt still hurting, will miss next start
item.description: Astros starter Roy Oswalt will miss his next start with lingering back pain.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Vikings' Tarvaris Jackson continues to rehab left knee
item.description: Vikings quarterback Tarvaris Jackson missed both practices again on Monday while doing rehab work on his injured left knee.

item.dc:creator: James Walker
item.title: Carson Palmer, of Cincinnati Bengals, returns to practice
item.description: After a two-day hiatus, Cincinnati Bengals starting quarterback Carson Palmer rejoined his team at training camp and participated in Cincinnati's Monday morning practice.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Washington Redskins' Albert Haynesworth says knee problem 'not serious'
item.description: Albert Haynesworth says his knee problem is "not serious" -- even though it kept him out of practice for the second day in a row.
